channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Nettles and PROW inaccessible., 22nd June
item.description:
We walked from Hatherley and Redding Cricket ground following the right of way to get to Leckhampton Lane. The map showed a bridge over Ham Brook. It was hard going with long grass and nettles. when we got to the tree line just before Ham Brook there were overgrown trees and 5ft high nettles. We couldn’t see where the ROW went. We had to turn back all the way to the cricket ground and walk along Shurdington Road. The map showed a bridge but we couldn’t get anywhere near it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Leckhampton Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Alarm sounding from green cabinet, 22nd June
item.description:
An alarting is sounding from green cabinet just after the subway under the A40 on the Elmbridge Court Roundabout. The only markings of the cabinet are EAST IR016. I'm not sure if this is a cabinet monitoring flooding in the subway or a cable/BT cabinet.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Anti social behaviour, 22nd June
item.description:
Leaving rubbish and thrown out discarded items outside the property on the path where it is has been blown all over the green area and across other gardens. It also blocks the path. This is a permanent ongoing issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Brown Close, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Subsidence of Honeybourne line railway bank resulting in garden subsidence, 22nd June
item.description:
Behind 1 Eldorado crescent the fence which marks the boundary with the railway cutting to the Honeybourne cycle/walkway is starting to subside. This appears to reflect subsidence of the bank. Some form of stabilisation of the bank is required to protect our garden from subsiding into the Honeybourne line.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Honeybourne, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Giant Hog Weed, 22nd June
item.description:
The Giant Hog Weed is located on a footpath near to Church Farm in Shurdington. If you take the footpath behind the Church and cross the bridge over Ham Brook you will see it growing there. The photo does not do it justice.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
